data.title: FontDescriptionProcessor Fixes
data.body:
This PR fixes the fonts generated by the `FontDescriptionProcessor` as described in #2741 to better match XNA font generation.
- Fixed character Y offsets.
- Corrected calculation of `LineSpacing`.
- Support the `UseKerning` flag.
- Reduced texture compression artifacts by using DXT3.

data.title: Point docs
data.body:
-Point is now fully documented
-Point and Vector2 gives conversion methods ToVector2 / ToPoint 
-Some comments unification

data.title: Make AndroidGamePlatform.Exit() to finish current activity.
data.body:
This is default back key press behavior (http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Activity.html#onBackPressed%28%29). Previously activity was kept alive.
This PR partially reverts https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2813

My game has the exit yes/no dialog. When user confirms exit and relaunches the game, exit dialog is still visible.

data.title: Fixed leaked subscription AndroidGameActivity.Paused/Resumed inside AndroidGamePlatform ctor
Can't set PreferredBackBufferWidth/PreferredBackBufferHeight with MonoGame WP8
data.body: As mentioned in the title, I changed PreferredBackBufferWidth/PreferredBackBufferHeight to 800/480, but in the emulator 720p the back buffer size is obviously larger than that...

data.title: Fixed license for all basic types
data.body: Just a simple fix and nobody will bother to do it next time.

data.title: XAct Volume Improvements
data.body:
This PR fixes the XAct volume implementation.
- XAct sounds are no longer affected by `SoundEffect.MasterVolume`.
- XAct sounds can have a volume greater than 1.0.
- XAct sounds better obey the `AudioCategory.Volume`.

To do this I had to remove support for XAudio2 using the mastering voice to set the `SoundEffect.MasterVolume`.  Instead it works like all the other platforms and updates the volume on each `SoundEffectInstance` when the `SoundEffect.MasterVolume` changes.

data.title: MGFX v5 Compatibility
data.body:
To keep compatibility with the old shaders in my ports, I added this block of code...

https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/commit/8932d4ab6435b6e67c5818f3cf98e880de5f212d

... but was not sure if this was something the original project wanted (I'm only doing this to put off extra work before I rewrite the Effect subsystem for FNA, to be honest). It does work, since the only change appears to be the precomputed hash, but maybe something like a warning message would work for v5 shaders, rather than silently passing (assuming we want it to pass at all).

data.title: Reduce Garbage on TouchPanelState.GetState()
data.body:
-Reduce the garbage generated by `TouchPanelState.GetState()`.
`GetState()` was generating garbage at a constant rate of 12Bytes/Frame.

-Update License.

data.title: ScissorRectangleTest Fix
data.body: Fixed one of the `ScissorRectangleTest` tests which was failing because we disabled the discarded render target clear in release builds.  By ensuring we always clear it makes the test consistent in debug and release without changing the goal of the test.

data.title: UseReferenceDevice Fix
data.body: This allows `GraphicsProfile.HiDef` when `GraphicsAdapter.UseReferenceDevice` is enabled.

data.title: Support UseReferenceDevice For Unit Tests
data.body: This PR adds support for `GraphicsAdapter.UseReferenceDevice` on DirectX desktop and WinStore platforms.  We then use the reference device when running any graphical unit tests.  This ensures that any driver issues on a particular system don't get in the way of validating that the code is working correctly.

Document Rectangle's public properties and fields, and remove some white...
data.body: ...space for consistency. The rest of the methods in this class used one line of space between methods - a couple methods had two lines. Again, let me know of improvements to make if desired - glad to make them.

data.title: Add XML docs for a few items in MonoGame.Framework.Point.cs
Font Pipeline Issues
data.body:
- It looks like the property grid is replacing a single empty character with the default/null-terminating character.
  To reproduce, try to process a SpriteFontTexture, and set its FirstCharacter to ' ' (a single space) via the property grid. Set a breakpoint in the processor and you'll notice that ' ' is replaced with '\0' in the Character/Glyph map.
- FontDescription is missing the Characters field: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.graphics.fontdescription.characters.aspx This prevents classes that derive from FontDescritpion from working in MonoGame's pipeline.

data.title: Eliminate garbage for Touch input
data.body:
Here's some changes I'd like to discuss: 
https://github.com/nkast/MonoGame/compare/tnc_EliminateTouchGarbage

Instead of allocating a new array on each `GetState()` call, we use a pre-allocated buffer.
In `GetState()` the next free part of the buffer is populated from `_touchState`.
`_touchBufferOffset` updated to point to the next free part. 
The returned `TouchCollection` is mapped to the copied contents of `_touchState`.

So far it seems to work fine!
In theory however, the buffer could be overlapped (or waste memory by over-engineering it's size).
@danzel, do you think this is in a good direction? How this could be made fool-proof? The problem is how we detect overlap, we need an event to mark the point of data no longer in use, maybe inside `Update()`, assuming that nobody is storing past `GetState()` results between frames.

We can encapsulate this buffer into a new class, say `CircularBuffer<T>():IList<T>` to make the code clear. This list will check for overlap and resize it's buffer when necessary. Allow a limited set of Stack/Queue-like operations like Add()/Remove() last, and random access GetAt()/this[].  
This list can have a `Clear()` method that returns a `ReadOnlyCircularBuffer<T>()` struct. The returned read only list will have the content so far while the list now is moved to a new offset.
The read only list will be used to populate the `TouchCollection`, which can be revert mostly back to it's original form.

In the long run, we can replace `_touchState` with this new list. Methods that manipulate the list need to be rewritten. For example, `AgeTouches()` will receive the Read-Only copy of touchLocations and the Cleared list. Instead of Removing elements from `touchState` it will Add elements to the output list by moving them from the Read-Only input list.

data.title: Unit Test Image Comparision Improvements
data.body:
This PR improves the image comparison we use in the unit tests to be a little more forgiving.  We now do the following steps to compare:
- Pick the smaller of the images... either the frame image or the reference image.
- Resize the images down to the common size using nearest neighbor filtering.
- Convert the image to greyscale to mask color differences not perceptible to the eye.
- Compute the absolute delta between the two greyscale images.
- Count the number of pixels above a tolerance of 3.

This is a pretty standard method of comparing images for similarity.  Most of all the visual unit tests now pass as they should.

There are 3 visual unit tests which fail, but there seem to be bugs in the rendering.
